definition: abbr. for 日本[Ri4 ben3], Japan

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Hunger was his daily portion while he was living with the Dursleys.
sentences.chinese: 住在德思礼家中里，挨饿是他注定要过的苦日子。

sentences.english: Well, now, Jim, I've lived that rough as you'd be ashamed to hear of.
sentences.chinese: 你瞧，吉姆，我过的这种苦日子连你听了都会害臊。

sentences.english: Lily had no mind for the vagabond life of the poor relation .
sentences.chinese: 丽莉受不了穷亲戚们那种乞丐般的苦日子。

sentences.english: She'd try not to be bitter, try not to be too much of a widow.
sentences.chinese: 她会尽量不去想苦日子，不去想太多寡妇的生活。

sentences.english: He went to Barbadoes, and there lived some years in very poor circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 他跑到巴佩道斯，在那里过了几年苦日子。

sentences.english: This kind of tough life you want me to live for 50 years?
sentences.chinese: 这样的苦日子，您要让我忍上50年？

definition: to be accustomed to (a certain lifestyle etc)
bitterness finishes, sweetness begins (idiom); the hard times are over, the good times just beginning
to break clear of all the troubles and hardships/to achieve success/to make it
to live comfortably/happy and prosperous life
to the end (of)/at the end of/in the end/to come to an end
brocade garments, jade meals (idiom); a life of luxury/extravagance
not having to worry about clothes and food (idiom)/to be provided with the basic necessities
tight (i.e. lacking money)/hard up/same as 緊巴巴|紧巴巴
